verses.verse: Then Elihu continued his speech, saying:
“Do you think that you can defend your uprightness by claiming that you are just before God?
For you said: ‘What does it mean to you? Or what would you gain if I sinned?’
I will provide an answer for you and your three friends as well.
“Look up to the skies and see; observe the clouds towering above you.
If you sin, how can that affect God? And if your offenses are multiplied, how do you hurt him?
If you are righteous, what do you give him? What does he receive from your hand?
Your wickedness affects only someone like you, and your righteousness affects only your fellow men.
“People cry out under the weight of oppression; they cry for help against the power of the mighty.
But not one of them asks, ‘Where is God, my Maker, who protects me during the night,
who gave us greater intelligence than the animals of the earth and made us wiser than the birds of the air?’
Although they cry out, God does not answer because of the pride of the wicked.
“But it is foolish to say that God does not hear or that the Almighty does not pay attention.
Even though you do not see him, he is aware of your plight, and you must wait for his decision.
But now, because God does not grow angry and punish and because he allows transgressions to go unheeded,
Job gives vent to his anger with empty talk and babbles a stream of utter nonsense.”
